author: Minal Aditi Lakra
title: Tokyo, Osaka, Fukuoka, Kagoshima, and More Hit by Flights Disruption as Japan Air Commuter Cancels 3 Flights and Leaving Hundreds Due to Severe Weather: Here Is What You Need to Know
text:
Japan Air Commuter (JAC) is currently facing significant operational challenges due to severe weather conditions across multiple regions like Tokyo, Osaka, Fukuoka, Kagoshima , and others in Japan . These weather-related flights disruption has led to 3 flight cancellations and 4 delays , stranding passengers on various domestic routes .
Flight Cancellations and Delays On August 28, 2025, JAC experienced both flight cancellations and delays. Below is a table summarizing the affected flights:

Reasons Behind the Weather-Related Disruptions The disruptions have been attributed to severe weather systems, including heavy rain, thunderstorms, and strong winds, which have been affecting various parts of Japan. The southwestern and western regions, particularly in and around the Kyushu area, have been most impacted. These weather patterns are typical during the late summer and early fall months, which is the peak of Japan’s typhoon season. Typhoons can often cause significant delays and cancellations for airlines, leading to widespread travel chaos.
In addition to the weather conditions, the regional airspace congestion and maintenance requirements at some airports have contributed to delays. The airline has stated that safety remains its top priority, which is why certain flights were canceled to avoid any potential safety risks in adverse weather.
Passenger Experiences and Rebooking Options Many passengers affected by the disruptions have expressed frustration over the lack of timely updates and limited rebooking options. For those who were unable to catch their connecting flights, JAC is offering rebooking on later flights where possible. However, availability is limited due to the ongoing disruptions. The airline is reportedly prioritizing passengers with tight connections, particularly those with international flights.
In some cases, JAC is also providing hotel accommodations for passengers who have been stranded overnight due to the cancellations. Travelers who have been affected by the disruptions are encouraged to keep receipts for any additional expenses, as the airline may reimburse passengers for certain costs related to the delays or cancellations.
For future passengers, JAC recommends monitoring its official website for updates, as well as downloading the airline’s mobile app for quick notifications about changes to flight statuses.
Impact on Other Airlines and Air Travel While Japan Air Commuter is the primary airline affected, other major airlines operating in Japan have also reported delays and cancellations due to the same weather conditions. ANA, Japan Airlines, and budget carriers like Peach Aviation have experienced disruptions in their flight schedules. This has led to crowded airports, especially in major hubs like Tokyo Narita (NRT), Osaka Kansai (KIX), and Fukuoka (FUK).
As a result, travelers have had to adapt to new itineraries, experience delays, and seek auxiliary means of transport, disrupting both foreign and local travel. Weather conditions have also disrupted Shinkansen high-speed trains, straining travelers’ ability to work around booking alternative transport.
Official Response Japan Air Commuter acknowledges the disruptions and is making to efforts to assist impacted travelers. A detailed explanation for the weather-related disruptions is absent at this time. Customers are encouraged to visit the airline’s official portal for the most relevant information and to contact customer service for further support.
Advice for Affected Passengers For passengers whose flights have been canceled or delayed, here are some tips to help navigate the situation:
Contact Customer Service Immediately : If you’re stuck at the airport, call JAC’s customer service or visit the airline’s customer service desk to inquire about rebooking or compensation options. Consider Alternative Transportation : If your flight is canceled and there are no immediate options for rebooking, consider alternative forms of transportation such as trains or buses. In some cases, other airlines may have available flights. Stay Informed : Check your flight status regularly through JAC’s website, mobile app, or airport flight boards. This will help you stay up to date on any changes or additional disruptions. Request Compensation : Depending on your flight’s circumstances, you may be entitled to compensation for delayed or canceled flights, especially if the disruption was within the airline’s control. Make sure to keep any receipts for additional expenses incurred due to the delay or cancellation. Take Advantage of Meal and Hotel Vouchers : JAC has provided meal and hotel vouchers to passengers affected by long delays or cancellations. Ensure you request these from the airline if needed. Looking Ahead: Preventive Measures and Future Disruptions In reaction to these disruptions, Japan Air Commuter is attempting to implement advanced meteorological services and develop better business continuity plans. This encompasses enhanced passenger information systems during inclement weather and improved rebooking procedures. While unacceptable weather delays are often unavoidable, the Japan Air Commuter is striving to provide the best possible service.
Moreover, JAC intends to further develop its fleet of aircraft to alleviate congestion on specific routes during peak seasons. This will also mitigate potential delays and cancellations while also accommodating the increased passenger demand.
